etymologies: mid 17th century: from American Spanish, from Nahuatl uatzin, probably imitative of its call

definitions: a large tree-dwelling tropical American bird with weak flight. Young hoatzins have hooked claws on their wings, enabling them to climb around among the branches.

notes.text: Opisthocomus hoazin, the only member of the family Opisthocomidae (order Galliformes or Cuculiformes)

shortDefinitions: large tree-dwelling tropical American bird with weak flight
